Transcript: Chris: Hey, you looking for someone?
Amy: I didn't know anyone was in here.
Chris: Oh, I'm sorry. I didn't mean to surprise you.
Amy: It's ok.
Chris: Actually, I was waiting for you to get back.
Amy: Well, I'd love to chat, but now's not a good time.

Chris: No, it won't take long. It's about what I was talking to you earlier. 
It's the -- figured out where I'd seen you before. It was in Philadelphia.
Amy: Well, I've never been to Philadelphia.
Chris: Really?
Amy: You must be thinking of somebody else.
Chris: No, not when I'm looking right at you.
Amy: Excuse me?

Chris: Well, I -- I'm holding a photograph. I know you can't see it. It was 
taken in a bar in Philadelphia. I'm in it, and so are you. Why would you lie to 
me about this?
Rafe: Don't you ever lay a hand on her!
Jamal: Go ahead, kill me, Rafe.

Alison: Please, don't, Rafe! I'm serious! Stop it, he can't breathe. You're 
going to kill him! Stop it. Stop! Stop! Stop. You scared me. Jamal, I'm so 
sorry.
[Jamal coughs]
Alison: Do you need some water or something? Do you want to sit down?

Jamal: Just stop! I don't want your help, Alison. I don't want 
anything from you.
Alison: You don't mean that.
Jamal: I mean it. Besides, looks like you got a new hero now.
[Monitor beeps]
Jack: Lucy --
Livvie: Lucy! What happened? Where's my dad?
Lucy: He's in there.
Livvie: Oh, no.

Lucy: No, no, no. Listen, it's going to be ok. You listen to me. We have come 
too far and worked too hard to have him in our lives. We're not going to lose 
him now.
Livvie: But he's --

Lucy: No, no buts. No buts. We're going to do whatever it takes to keep him 
with us, if we have to pray, if we have to will for it to happen. We cannot lose 
him now. We won't -- we won't lose him now.
Colleen: Here's the CAT scan you ordered.
Eve: What does it show?
Ian: No bleeds, generalized swelling. Closed head injury.
Eve: No --
Ian: We've got to move fast or we're going to lose him.
Eve: Oh, no. We need an E.E.G. and a neuro consult.
Ian: No time for that. We already know there's no bleeding.
Eve: But we need an E.E.G. To make sure. What are you doing?
Ian: Administering steroids and Canitol, 100 milligrams. I'm inducing a coma.
Eve: Ian, no! Don't!
[Captioning made possible by ABC, Inc., and SOAPnet]
Rafe: Wait, what did I walk in on here? Did he hurt you? What --

Alison: No, no. Jamal was just saying that he was leaving me. And I was 
trying to get him to talk to me and to really just talk with me, and I pulled 
him. And I fell, and it was an accident.
Rafe: Jamal, I'm sorry.
Jamal: Save it. All right?
Rafe: No. No, I mean, I walked in here, and I saw what I saw, and --

Jamal: And you rode right to the rescue, yeah. Look, I got it, all right? 
Rafe, it's cool, man.

Alison: No, it's not cool! None of this is cool. We really need to talk. I'm 
serious.
Rafe: Yeah, I'll go.

Jamal: No, no. Not you. Stay, Rafe. In fact, you know what? Make yourself at 
home, ok? Ali, you know what? No more talking. I got my mind made up. Ok, you 
and me, we don't work anymore. It's time to cut our losses, all right?

Alison: Oh, Jamal. Please, what are you saying to me? That you don't love me 
anymore? Because, Jamal, I don't believe that. And I will never believe that.

Jamal: Well, believe it. What, do you want me to say it? I'll say the words, 
Alison.
Alison: No.
Jamal: I don't love you anymore.
Eve: How could you take that risk?
Ian: I had to.

Eve: You induced a coma without an E.E.G. We needed to fully assess his 
condition before you ever made that call!
Ian: There was no time. His life was at stake, doctor.
Eve: And you just threw away any chance we had of trying something else.

Ian: There wasn't any chance to try anything else. I wasn't just going to sit 
here and wait.

Eve: The only thing we can do now is wait. Because the only thing we do know 
is that he may never come out of this.
Victor: Lucy. Livvie. How's Monk?
Lucy: Well, we're not quite sure. We're waiting to hear.
Ian: Hey.
Lucy: So --
Livvie: Ian, what's going on?

Ian: We had a bit of a scare with some swelling on the brain, but he seems to 
have stabilized now.
Mary: Oh, thank God.
Eve: That's not everything.
Livvie: What does that mean?

Ian: I made an unconventional choice to reduce the workload on the brain and 
prevent a seizure.
Victor: In English?
Ian: In order to keep Kevin alive, I had to put him in a coma.
Livvie: My dad's in a coma?

Lucy: It's ok. It's going to be ok. If Ian says that's what's best for him, I 
trust him. I have faith in him.
Ian: I'll let you know as soon as you can see him, ok?
Lucy: Thank you.
Victor: Well, how did this happen? What -- how did he get this way?

Lucy: I don't know. I'm not sure what exactly happened. I found him out in 
the snowstorm. He was lying down, being covered with snow, and a live electrical 
wire was lying right beside him. And he must've been shocked. And, oh, my God, 
he could've been lying out there for hours, freezing to death.

Livvie: No, no, no. Wait a minute. He told Paige that he was walking me to my 
car. How could he have been out there for so long without her even noticing?

Lucy: I don't know. Unless she believed he came back in the house, maybe, and 
just didn't realized he hadn't?
Livvie: And you didn't check? I mean, weren't you worried?
Paige: Well, I didn't --

Livvie: What kind of woman are you? You knew my father was coming back to the 
attic, and you did nothing. I mean, you didn't even think to go look for 
him. What is wrong with you?
Victor: Livvie, Livvie --

Livvie: Why are you even here? Why didn't you just stay where you came from? 
Couldn't you see that my father was happy? If he dies, it is all your fault, 
Paige. It's your fault!

Rafe's Voice: You have to tell us. Now, there are four of us, but five 
chairs. So someone's got to be coming back with us, right? Someone's going to 
die.
Ed's Voice: People die every day.

Rafe's Voice: Right, but this is different, isn't it? It's going to be 
someone who's close to one of us.

Paige: They don't understand. I didn't, either, but now I do. Now I know 
exactly why I've come back into Kevin's life.

Amy: I'm not lying, Chris. The woman in the picture may look like me, but 
she's not.

Chris: Unless you have an identical twin floating around out there. This is 
an exact match.

Amy: Well, then, let's just agree to disagree. I think I'd know if I'd been 
to Philadelphia.
Chris: Yeah, you'd think.
Amy: Why is this suddenly so important to you?

Chris: Well, let's just say I like to keep well-informed. And I don't like 
any surprises when I'm taking someone out.
Amy: Well, then, I'll make it easy for you. I'm breaking our date.
Chris: What?

Amy: I don't need the third degree from someone I don't know over something 
that didn't happen.
Chris: Ok, ok. Fine. It's not you in the picture.
Amy: Thank you. What are you doing?
Chris: I'm storing the evidence. So, pick you up at 8:00 tomorrow?

Amy: Obviously, you didn't hear me. When I go out with someone, I like to be 
well-informed, too. And now I am. You're a complete ass.
Chris: Oh.
Amy: Oh.
Chris: So, that's a definite no?
Amy: Definite.
Chris: Ok. Well, Amy, have a good life, I guess. See you in Philly.
Amy: I've got to get that picture.
Ian: What was the time of injection?
Eve: I was trying to stop it, remember?
Ian: That's how it's going to be, is it?
Eve: What do you think?

Ian: I think a couple of things -- number one, I made the right choice. 
Number two, you need to deal with it.
Eve: You made it unilaterally.
Ian: You're taking this personally?

Eve: Yes! Of course I am taking this personally. This is Kevin we are talking 
about. And you took it upon yourself to just charge in and save the day when we 
had other options.
Ian: I made the right professional choice.
Eve: In my professional opinion, doctor, you screwed up.

Livvie: I know I should've stayed with my dad. I was being such a brat, and 
then I left mad.
Jack: Hey, sweetie, your dad knows you love him.

Livvie: Yeah, but he was just trying to make things better, Jack. Like he 
always does for everyone. I mean, when I first came to Port Charles, he didn't 
even know me, and he helped me. He's been there for me every step of the way, 
and I haven't been there for him at all.
Jack: Don't do this.

Livvie: It's just that he's the best dad I could've ever asked for. And I 
haven't gotten to be his daughter long enough. I haven't shown him how lucky I 
feel to have him in my life.
Jack: Look, he knows. Trust me, he knows.

Victor: You, me, Monk. We've been through so much together. We have a long 
way to go yet.

Lucy: I know. Boy, have we been through a lot, huh? You know, I've waited so 
long to be with that man. Victor, I'm not about to give up on him now.

Victor: But you've never given up on him. You've brought such love into his 
life. I've never seen him happier.

Lucy: Good. I'm glad it's because of us. You know, it's because we're finally 
a real family. I know that's the one thing he wanted most of all in his life.

Ian: I'm going to tell Lucy and the rest of the family that they can come in. 
Unless there are any objections from the chief resident.
Eve: Would it matter if there were?
Ian: Hey.
Lucy: Ian, what?
Ian: No changes, but if you want to go see him, this would be a good time.
Lucy: Thanks.
Livvie: You go ahead, Lucy, ok? Because I'm not quite ready yet.
Lucy: Ok.
Victor: Any change?

Eve: No. No, Victor, but we're just going to have to wait and see how he 
responds.

Lucy: Ok. Thank you, both of you. You kept him breathing, and, so you've done 
your part. And now I think it's up to all of us. Listen to me, it's us, his 
family --
Livvie: Ok.

Lucy: All our words and love that's going to make all the difference in Doc 
surviving.
Livvie: Ok.
Lucy: I believe that with all my heart. Ok.
[Monitor beeps]

Alison: I've heard you. Ok, I finally heard you. I'm not going to fight you 
on this anymore. I know it's over.
Rafe: Alison, no, come on --

Alison: No, I'm sorry. You know what? I'm so sorry, but I listened to what 
you had to say, and now you're going to listen to what I have to say. 
Jamal, I have been putting up with the way that you've been treating me this 
whole time because I knew -- listen to me! I'm serious! Because I knew that you 
were hurting. And I knew that you were blaming yourself for Valerie's death, 
even though it wasn't your fault, and you need to take it out on somebody, and 
that somebody was me. And that was fine. Because I really wanted to help you any 
way that I could. And I knew that you would look back on it, and that you would 
realize that Valerie's death was exactly what it was -- it was a tragic 
accident. Ok, and it was nobody's fault. You know, we used to turn to each other 
when things were really tough. God, we have been through so much. And now 
you're just -- you're throwing your life away because you think that it's 
somehow going to magically take care of Valerie's death or something. I don't 
know. You didn't do anything! She tried to kill me, and then she tried to 
kill you.
Jamal: She wouldn't have done anything.
Alison: Are you forgetting that?
Jamal: Look, I don't want to talk about this.

Alison: No, listen. I know you don't want to talk about this, but stop and 
listen to me! I never thought I'd ever say this to you. I don't even recognize 
you anymore. So if you want to get away from me, then why don't you go?
Alison: Why don't you leave, Jamal? Leave!
Alison: I'm sorry. I want you to go, too.
Chris: Did you find what you're looking for?
Alison: First you come barging in here like you're going to kill Jamal.
Rafe: Well, because I thought he was hurting you.

Alison: And then I kick him while he's down, and basically tell him to get 
out.
Rafe: No, that's not exactly how it happened.

Alison: Well, however it happened, it was awful! And all those stupid things 
that I said --
Rafe: Because you were hurting and angry. That's why you did that.

Alison: I know, and I still am, and I already told you to leave! Why haven't 
you left?
Rafe: Because I don't think you should be alone right now.
Alison: Oh, and you don't give a damn about what I want?

Rafe: Yes, yes, yes, I do! I do. It's just that, do you really know what you 
want?

Alison: Don't you under-- don't you understand how hard this is for me? I 
have loved Jamal for so long. I don't know what it feels like to not love him or 
be loved by him.

Rafe: Look, you know, maybe that's because you two were really meant to be 
together.

Alison: No, no, no. No, it's changed. And I never thought that it would 
change. But then there's you. And you complicate things for me.
Rafe: I'm sorry.
Alison: No.
Rafe: All I ever really meant to do was --
Alison: What?
Rafe: Be there for you.

Alison: And you have. And maybe that's part of the problem. See, I don't want 
you here. For me, for this. Ok? Not now. I don't want you consoling me because I 
can't deal with that. And I just -- I can't deal with you.
Rafe: Ok.
[Phone rings]
Alison: Hello?
Livvie: Alison?
Alison: Livvie? What's the matter?
Livvie: My dad's in a coma, and I'm so scared he might die.
Alison: I'll be right there, ok, sweetie? Ok.
Rafe: What is it?
Alison: Livvie -- Kevin is in a coma, and he might die.

Lucy: Hey, Doc. It's me. I'm back from that overnight with Christina and 
Serena. We had such a wonderful time. Next time you have to go with us. I took 
lots of pictures, bought you lots of stuff, and -- listen, everybody's here 
outside. Victor and Mary and Jack and Livvie -- everybody, all your family. 
They're here because we're not letting you go anywhere. You know how you always 
tease me about us? You know, about what we have just defies all logic. Well, we 
defy everything, Doc, together. And that includes this. My love for you is 
bigger than anything I can explain. It's confusing, though, because you know I 
like to explain everything and try to tell everybody what the universe means. 
Well, all I know, I absolutely know for sure, is you. You're my hope. My love 
for you is so deep in my soul that do you know I can feel you every second of 
every single day? No matter where you are, no matter where I am, I feel you. And 
that feeling wraps me up and takes me to a place that I never, ever want to 
leave. So, Doc, please. Please, don't leave me. Please? Please, don't go. Don't 
leave!
[Lucy gasps]
Lucy: Doc? Oh, my God. Ian! Ian! Ian!
Ian: Two milligrams of Lorazepam I.V. Push!

Eve: Get out of the way, Lucy. We need a C.T. to ensure he doesn't have a 
bleed.
Lucy: What's happening?
Ian: Phenytoin loading dose.
Lucy: What's happening to him? Tell me! Ian! Oh, my God. Ian! Ian!
Kevin: Where am I?
Kevin: Paige?
Kevin: What's going on?
Paige: This is your destiny, Kevin. It's our destiny.
>> On the next "Port Charles" --
Chris: What could I possibly want from you?
Amy: My body. You do want to sleep with me, don't you?
Alison: He's going to be ok. He will.
Livvie: It's going to take a miracle.

Alison: So, tell her, Rafe. You're an angel. Tell her there's going to be a 
miracle.
Paige: It's time for you to leave this world and cross over to the next.
